Tim Treakle

review_title: If You Saw This On Netflix, Stay Away
review_detailed_main:
I consider myself a horror connoisseur. It's my favorite genre. I love legitimately great horror films like the Shining or the Conjuring, cult classics like Evil Dead, and campy slashers like Friday the 13th part 8. The point is that I can typically enjoy a horror movie, even if it's kind of bad. But, this film is BAD. It's not even so bad it's good, it's not even enjoyable. It's So Bad it's BAD. I may have gotten a laugh a time or two, but they were very few and far between. Even drinking with friends while watching wouldn't make this enjoyable.

I'll be honest, I've never seen the original Cabin Fever. It's actually why I watched this one. I found this remake on Netflix and got 10 minutes in before realizing it had to be a remake (references to Call of Duty Black OPs and Grand Theft Auto 5 would be anachronistic in a 2002 film) and decided to press on. So as someone with no affiliation with the original source material, I can't compare it to the original. However, I can tell you that as a movie, this film is terrible. The writing is awful (I can't even put into words how bad), the acting is all over the place, and the characters are written to be so stupid that the characters from Friday the 13th (2009) look like Nobel Prize winners by comparison. It's not scary and they also have a few really terrible jump scares where it turns out to be their friends or some random person.

Horror typically requires some suspension of disbelief. But there's suspension of disbelief and then there's that little voice in your head practically begging you to turn it off. But, I completed the film just so that I can tell you to heed my warning and save yourself 90 minutes of your life. If there was any reason for you to watch it (even you horror fans out there), I'd be honest and tell you.

But just to be fair, here's the stuff I "liked":

-It's mercifully short -I'll admit that the gore is okay, but as someone who likes gore (you can go see any of my ratings on much worthier horror films), there are far better choices than this. -Some of the cinematography looked pretty good -The main guy wasn't the worst actor ever, even if everyone else is pretty bad. (Looking at you, girl who played Winston and the guy with the rifle) -The car chase scene/tracking scene was decent. Nowhere near the best I've ever seen, but competent. -This movie had some money thrown at it. I don't know if that makes it better or worse.

TLDR: Save your time. Pretty damn terrible

I'm not sure what's going on with the film industry but someone needs to step up and fix it.

I mean where do I even start.... This movie is shameful. Bad acting, bad script and just one big old mess.

I feel embarrassed for the whole team.

I'm just speechless.

Things that made no sense at all and had me banging my head against the wall.

E.g. Girl catches virus, is bleeding and wounded... what a perfect time to take a bath and shave her legs.... Like... WHAT!!??

Please please please who ever let this slip, tell me what was going through your head. No really I need to know.

I just can't anymore. I've given up on the movie industry.

For anyone who liked this film, even the tiniest bit, I pray to God that you never reproduce and may the lord have mercy on your soul.

review_title: Nothing New. Very Average Horror Remake.

review_detailed_main: Disappointed with the movie .Waited for almost 45 minutes forthe movie to actually progress,., The good thing here , is if you are a gore fan , you can see some of that in this movie but still fails to redeem the entire movie.

The Greasy Strangler is a 1 rating! Go check it out!

A 1 rating is a movie you could make yourself with a 2nd hand video cam and paying the actors with free crack! ! Ok, so you didnt like the movie. We get it. Then give it a 4 or 5.

Quality recording, music, sound, acting good. Great scenery. Helicoptor aerial filming aint cheap either. Story not award winning...yes. But entertaining if you are a horror buff.

Classic idiots in a scary movie, running around and making really bad decisions. I mean, they "quarantine" the sick girl but go in the shed every five minutes? The storyline is pretty ridiculous even by scary movie standards, what's with the sheriff and the backwoods hillbillies? The acting itself is just bad. But, the gore and special effects really work, it was gross and gory.

review_title: What did I tell you about biting city folks?

review_detailed_main: I really liked the one that came out in 02 but i probably havent seen it in 20 years so when i stumbled onto this one thinking it was a reboot or continuation or something like the new Jeepers Creepers or Wrong Turn (both of which i liked a little bit more than the original movies) i decided to check it out. Sadly it took me way too long to realize it was a remake, and a pretty decent one at that. Some aspects of this i really liked more than the original, and others felt a bit over the top in unnecessary ways....but such is the way of horror flicks. Overall i liked it a lot and will probably give it a rewatch at some point. I do find it super ridiculous to remake a movie so soon after the original came out, but i am happy with the result.

Eli roth is a great director, and with the likes of the hostel series he has established himself as a great. Despite this film not being liked I thought it was good, but not as great as the orignal as it didnt have that real creepy vibe and in places played off more like a comedy at times. We have our group of nearly thirty year old college kids. Karen, jeff, paul, macy and henry and its spring break so why not go down to a luxury looking cabin but they are unaware of whats really lurking in the woods there that being some strange virus that seems to be going around. Paul is the only character thats written here to be smart as soon as he sees an infected person hes like hell no and shuts them off. The gore is alright but theres not enough filling for this sandwhich but its still enjoyable which ever way you look at it.
